name: Hyatt Westlake Plaza in Thousand Oaks

reviews.text: I just completed a stay at the Hyatt Westlake Village. The public areas are attractive with fountains and seating areas. However, the rooms are bare bones, run-of- the-mill accomodations which featured standard bedding and small bathrooms. There is definitely audible traffic noise from the rooms near the highway. Closing the drapes at night muffled the sounds considerably. I opted for a weekend rate of $99 which included breakfast. I only visited the restaurant for breakfast which was served buffet style and was tasty. I am pleased that I opted for the free breakfast hotel rate as the breakfast for two would have been $27. The view into the gardens from the restaurant was appealing. The service at the hotel was not engaging with the customers. I was not greeted by the valet or any other staff I encountered in the hallways. This hotel seems to cater to the convention crowd (there was one going on this weekend) and forgoes personal service. The lodging options are limited in this area so competition does not keep management "on their toes".
reviews.title: Hyatt in name only

reviews.text: I stayed here in February... it was a nice, quiet hotel with great access to the freeway. My room and the workout area were clean and decently appointed. There was a free paper in the morning and lots of TV channels, but no free internet access anywhere. There is a great outdoor market-type mall across the freeway.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, good location
Top of the line!
reviews.text: I frequent The Hyatt Westlake quite often and have to say that it's amazing! The staff is courteous and friendly. The housekeeping department will do everything to make you comfortable and will turn down the sheets if you request. Be pleasantly surprised to arrive with chocolates on your bed. The rooms are neoclassic looking with your own private balcony. The decor is beautiful! Water fountains and intricately ornate wrought iron mirrors-perfect for a wedding with a wonderful garden in the back. The food is impeccable and Sunday Brunch is a class act! You will have a wonderful time.

reviews.title: A Hotel In Which You Can't Sleep
reviews.text: This isn't a Hyatt. We expected an upscale and beautiful, at least quiet, hotel based on our experience with Hyatt. This hotel is an outlier of Hyatt hotel. We phoned to check in and asked a room with garden view by 2pm and was told that it was booked up and all rooms with garden view were taken. Give me a break. Who would believe all garden view rooms were taken by 2pm. After check in, we found out that they had a weekend party (we stayed there on Friday) by the pool.

reviews.title: Westlake Plaza is pretty nice overall
reviews.text: Room was very nice. Staff was very good. Hotel is going through some renovation but no big deal. Only complaint is that on Saturday night the bar was very loud and a few drunk idiots ran up and down the halls then proceeded to fight outside the exterior window. Never complained and problem went away. They must have passed out or left, whatever. I would stay there again especially at the rate I got on well known internet site. What a bargain for such a nice property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: what started out to be a frustrating stay at the Hyatt, ended wonderful, when I talked to the mod in charge at the time which was Andy Kim, not only did he listen but he genuinely cared about my experience here, he reassured me of one of my concerns and the confusion and frustration I experienced earlier that morning in the restaurant was absolved with breakfast for my husband and I the next morning, and to top it off when we got back to our room a were surprised with apple cider and strawberries (which I was pregnant at the time and could not have champagne) the management staff did exceedingly well in addressing our concerns and made our stay a wonderful and memorable one, thanks again Hyatt. Also the best beds EVER!
reviews.title: saved my trip

reviews.text: We have stayed a few times over the years. Our first trip after it opened in the 80's right through today! Love it good location lots to do and fabulous shopping food And film close by.
reviews.title: Everything was 1st Class!

reviews.text: I spent four nights at the Hyatt Westlake while visiting family in Thousand Oaks. With the exception of the first night, I had a happy and relaxing stay. I had initially requested a suite and whilst lovely, there was definitely a stale cigarette smell in the room which really bothered me. I was told when I complained the next morning that it was a no smoking room. Having said that it was clear that people were smoking out on the little patio (cigarette butts on the ground) which was clearly wafting into the room. So, buyer beware on that one. I was moved to a 4th floor king view for the rest of my stay and was very happy with that. The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable and the outlook out to the trees was relaxing. Room service and housekeeping were terrific and front desk couldn't do enough for me. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Good hotel stay

reviews.text: The Hyatt in Westlake Village is a lovely hotel but there were some issues they need to address. This feels like one of those hotels that caters only to business travelers of the solo male nature. It has a great desk area and chair and a dozen ESPN channels but not all of us are business travelers or men. We stayed here for 2 nights over the holidays and had several problems. My parents, in their late 70's and my son and I had our own rooms. My parents do not use beds like chairs. They actually need chairs with backs for support and other than the desk chair on wheels there was no seating available in the room. It wasn't for lack of size. There was plenty of room to create a small seating area. A couple of chairs would have been very nice.
reviews.title: Some help needed

reviews.text: The second issue was the keys. They were awful. Try, try and try again and maybe after a half dozen times you might get them to work. They need to break down and buy some new keys. It is really frustrating trying to get them to work.
reviews.title: Great warmth, friendliness, service and atmosphere - Feels like Home.

reviews.text: I travel to California several times per year for business. Hands down, this is my favourite hotel to stay at. I say this based on a combination of the hotel itself, price, and location.
reviews.title: my favourite hotel in the greater LA area
Below Average Hyatt
reviews.text: This is a standard Hyatt (not a Grand Hyatt or Regency). It is a standard hotel that would be on par with a Marriott (above a Hilton for sure). Over the past 5 years I have seen the rooms be renovated 3x (two minor, 1 major overhaul). The restaurant is very good too. The room is above average in size, the bathroom is typical for a hotel over 10 years old (small, but well appointed).

reviews.title: Nice Stay at Hyatt
reviews.text: You can't beat the neighbourhood for safety and security (after all you are in good company in Westlake / 1000Oaks - Wayne Gretzky lives here!). You are right on the 101 too.
I typically pay $150 per night although it does fluctuate up/down a bit as would be expected. This is a popular place so be sure to make a reservation a few weeks ahead of time.
reviews.title: An overall good experience.

reviews.text: The outdoor pool/spa are decent, but not spectacular.
reviews.title: WHAT - No Pool !!!

reviews.text: Rooms were very comfortable, the areas are very nice and the service was good in general. Everything worked as expected.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel all around.

reviews.text: Ive been staying at the Hyatt almost weekly since August. I have grown to measure all other hotel staff and facilities based on this location. By far the staff here are the nicest and most helpful, no matter what time it is. By far a most definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Hyatt Brand

reviews.text: We had a family event held at this hotel the weekend (party in ballroom, brunch, etc.) Front desk was very accommodating. I asked for a quiet room and was pleased they put me on third floor across from pool area. No problem with an early check in, either. Beds comfy, in room coffee maker, wide screen tv. Room quiet. Nice ammenities, The pool area is very nice- heated pool. Plenty of towels next to chairs. The workout room was small but had several treadmills and free weights. Parking is free although you do have an option to pay for valet parking. Knuckles Bar made decent drinks but the bar food is mediocre.
reviews.title: Nice property-great location

reviews.text: The best thing about this location is that it is across the street (as in easy walking distance) to an upscale outdoor shopping center with three grocery stores (Von's Sprouts, and Gelsons) a CVS drug store, and tons of great restaurants - Tuscany's is AMAZING. East Coast Bagel for morning bagel and coffee. Jack's literally has a 22 page menu and portions are huge. Brent's Deli is decent but very pricey. Gelson's has a great salad bar and provides tables in front of store for outside "to go" dining.
reviews.title: Fine hotel, but not that charming;)

reviews.text: I wouldn't pay a rack rate of $189.00 a night for this hotel but If you need to be in the area and can grab this hotel at a decent, discounted rate, I'd say to go for it.
reviews.title: Friendly people in an older hotel

reviews.text: After spending 4 nights at this hotel, I would say the housekeeping definitely needs overhauling. With out going into detail, some of the basic items were not cleaned on a daily basis. The grounds of the hotel are very nice however I did hear the freeway noise at night while going to sleep. After traveling to this area over a dozen times I would say spend the extra money and stay at the Four Seasons Westlake.
reviews.title: Older hotel, housekeeping is not up to par.

reviews.text: After speaking for more than 30 minutes to Hyatt HQ for reservations for three rooms (possibly representing more $1000/day when considering rooms, food and drinks) at the Hyatt at Westlake, they suggested I speak with their reservations agent at their Westlake site. This made sense given the different rooms we wanted and wanting the rooms to be close together, something HQ wouldn't necessarily be able to address. After leaving messages and calling several times without a call back, I have to wonder about their service and whether I really want to give them my business.
reviews.title: Hyatt is unresponsive

reviews.text: This hotel is simple and lean. The staff is super helpful and friendly. It's a great place to stay if you are in the area. Free hotel parking is very nice too. Plenty of places to eat and shop within easy walking distance.
reviews.title: Westlake Hyatt recommendation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would really rate this hotel as a 3.75. Much better than a 3, but not quite a 4!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Older Property, Great Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby and the hotel look nice, almost Mediterranean style.
reviews.title: Service Trumps Everything!

reviews.text: There is no hotel I have stayed at more than this one. It was also my first Hotel stay as a business traveler.
reviews.title: My favorite (business stay) hotel !

reviews.text: Hotel is very classy and has a Mediterranean feel to it. The staff is always warm and friendly at the front desk and bar area...actually all the staff are quite nice.
reviews.title: Go see Hector in Knuckles Sports Bar

reviews.text: This hotel is situated with great hwy access and nestled in the "down-town" core of Westlake Village where you can walk to some very nice restaurants and occasionally see celebrities if that's what you're into...I think Tom Selleck is a resident because I see him around all the time.
reviews.title: Amazing Front Desk Service

reviews.text: We've been visiting Westalke for the past 3 years for business travel and always stay at the Hyatt. We've always had excellent service from check in to check out. After a hard day of work, we typically visit Hector and his counterparts in the Knuckles Sports Bar. He takes care of the guests in a way that makes you feel that you are home. We've had months go by before a visit and he always remembers our names, drinks and food orders. Go see Hector....you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: I recently stayed two nights at the Westlake Village Hyatt. The location was great for freeway access and getting around for my busienss meetings up the 101. Gabrielle, who was working the front desk was very friendly and professional. After having a very long tough travel day she made my check-in effortless and quick, later she also helped me locate a great local steak house (Mastros). When back in town I will definitely be staying here again!
reviews.title: Fantastic service and lovely, clean rooms

aka: Hyatt Westlake Plaza Hotel Westlake Village
description: Escape from the ordinary in Southern California at the extraordinary Hyatt Westlake Plaza in Thousand Oaks. A unique combination of outstanding business facilities and a resort-like atmosphere, lush gardens and relaxing décor create a Mediterranean luxurious hotel oasis in the center of this busy Thousand Oaks business complex in Westlake Village. Conduct meetings in elegant, updated venues, host an outdoor reception in the warm California sun, or court clients at a nearby golf course. Take advantage of our luxury hotel's ideal location to visit sights from LA to Malibu, Ventura or Santa Barbara with ease. Discover for yourself the outstanding services and welcoming staff that make Hyatt Westlake Plaza in Thousand Oaks a perennial favorite.
